solution_line_template: The number of red flowers is twice as many as orange so {red_multiplier} * {orange_flowers} orange = <<{red_multiplier}*{orange_flowers}={red_flowers}>>{red_flowers} red flowers

The number of yellow flowers is {yellow_less_than_red} less than red so {red_flowers} red - {yellow_less_than_red} = <<{red_flowers}-{yellow_less_than_red}={yellow_flowers}>>{yellow_flowers} yellow flowers

The number of red, orange and yellow flowers is {red_flowers} red + {orange_flowers} orange + {yellow_flowers} yellow = <<{red_flowers}+{orange_flowers}+{yellow_flowers}={sum_red_orange_yellow}>>{sum_red_orange_yellow} flowers

The number of pink and purple flowers total is {total_flowers_in_garden} flowers total - {sum_red_orange_yellow} flowers that are not pink or purple = <<{total_flowers_in_garden}-{sum_red_orange_yellow}={pink_purple_total}>>{pink_purple_total} flowers

The number of pink and purple flowers each is {pink_purple_total} flowers / {number_of_pink_purple_colors} = <<{pink_purple_total}/{number_of_pink_purple_colors}={pink_purple_each}>>{pink_purple_each} flowers each
